explanation: The report is correct. In the supplied project mhd_assert is defined as ((void)0), so every mhd_assert(...) call in get_rq_uname becomes an executed no-op expression statement. Removing those statements would not change the program behaviour of this project configuration, which exactly matches MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2’s definition of dead code. (Note: if the project were built with a different definition of mhd_assert that performed runtime checks, the statements would not be dead in that build — MISRA is applied to the project as delivered, so the current definition determines compliance.) The empty test log simply indicates the function was not exercised by the test harness and does not affect the correctness of the dead-code determination.
